title: Final velocity of dropped vs thrown object

content.question: An object of unknown mass is initially at rest and dropped from a height h. It reaches the ground with a velocity <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0"> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. The same object is then raised again to the same height h but this time is thrown downward with velocity <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0"> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. It now reaches the ground with a new velocity <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0"> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. How is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0"> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> related to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mstyle displaystyle="true" scriptlevel="0"> <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>?

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
